name: Technical SEO
summary: Optimizing website infrastructure to help search engines crawl, index, and rank content effectively.
explanation: Technical SEO ensures search engines can access and understand your site. Key areas include: crawlability (can search engines find your pages?), indexability (can they be added to the index?), site speed (Core Web Vitals), mobile-friendliness (responsive design), site architecture (logical URL structure, internal linking), structured data (schema markup), and security (HTTPS). Technical issues can tank rankings regardless of content qualityâ€”if Google can't crawl your site, it can't rank it. Common issues include: broken links, duplicate content, slow loading, missing meta tags, and poor mobile experience. For creators, technical SEO often means: choosing a fast, well-coded platform, using proper heading structure, optimizing images, and ensuring mobile responsiveness. Fix technical foundations before focusing on content.
